lines.content: * Class containing main() method. Exception handling and highest level of program logic is implemented here.
* Initial startup code and loading from saved data if found is done here. Saved data filename and location is
* hardcoded in this implementation. data folder will be created if none exists.
* @param filePath is a String for a filename, assumed to be in src/data.
* Highest level of program logic and exception handling is in this method. To be called only by main().
* This exception is currently used only when the application recognises the command, but the necessary description
* is empty, or if the saved data has an improper format.
* Class responsible for parsing and understanding user input.
private static void checkDescription(String in) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("Command has empty description");
* Takes in a String representing user input, and parses it, producing the appropriate Command.
* @param in is a String representing user input.
* @return Command to be executed by the application.
* @throws DukeException if the user's input is missing a description.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the user's command gives a index that is out of bounds.
* @throws NumberFormatException if the user's command has an index that the application does not understand.
* @throws DateTimeParseException if the user's command has a date that does not match "yyyy-mm-dd" format.
public static Command parse(String in) throws DukeException,IndexOutOfBoundsException,
* Class responsible for saving and loading the data at the start and end of application runs.
* When a Storage object is initialised, it will create the data directory in the source directory.
* Currently filename represents where the data is to be saved, and it is hard-coded in Duke.java.
* @param filename is the file the application will write to, in the data folder.
* Load locates the saved data if it exists, and parses it to create a TaskList representing the saved sessions
* data. Uses a Ui object to print notices informing a user if errors occur, when the load begins, and when it ends.
* @param ui to print notices to user
* @return a list of tasks saved from previous session.
* @throws IOException if initialising the reader fails, or reading from the save data causes an error.
* @throws DukeException if the saved data has a format that is not recognised.
public ArrayList<Task> load(Ui ui) throws IOException, DukeException {
* Given a TaskList from the current session and a Ui object, method attempts to save the session in a text file.
* Method prints notices to the user for when the saving begins and ends.
* @param tasklist contains the tasks from the current session.
* @param ui Ui object to print notices to the user.
* @throws IOException if writing to the text file fails, or initialising the writer fails.
public void save(TaskList tasklist, Ui ui) throws IOException {
//converts a Task into a string to be saved to a txt file.
//dual of formatForSave. Converts from saved string back to Task.
private Task formatForLoad(String s) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("format of saved data is incorrect");
* Class to manage the list of users tasks during an application run. Class is basically an alias for
* Java's arraylist with a more limited interface, implemented due to course requirements.
* Constructor called when loading in data.
* @param loadedData loadedData is the TaskList from a previous session.
* Ui class to handle printing notices to the user, and reading of user input to pass to Parser.
* Initialise scanner to read user input.
* @return one line of user input as a String.
* Method called at beginning of application run. Prints welcome message.
System.out.println("I'm Frosty, your personal task manager! How can I help?");
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + tasklist.size() + " tasks in the list.");
public void notifySuccessfulMarkDone(TaskList tasklist, int index) {
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
public void notifySuccessfulDelete(TaskList tasklist, Task removed) {
System.out.println("Now you have " + tasklist.size() + " tasks in the list.");
System.out.println("Sorry! I don't know what your request means. Please try again?");
System.out.println("An error occurred while loading in the saved data...");
System.out.println("Have a Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year!");
System.out.println("It look like you have a previous session! Loading your data now...");
System.out.println("Just a moment, i'm saving your list!");
System.out.println("Something went wrong and I can't save your list, sorry!");
System.out.println("Sorry! Your command has an invalid index choice");
System.out.println("Sorry! I can't understand the index for your command");
System.out.println("Sorry! Your command appears to be missing a description");
System.out.println("Sorry! I don't recognise the format for the date and time you've entered.");
System.out.println("I've found the data folder. Your session will be saved there.");
System.out.println("I couldn't find a data folder. I've initialised one for your data.");
* Implements the logic for adding a Task to the users list.
* Constructor called when adding a Todo task to the list.
* @param type Type tells execute method the kind of Task object to create.
* @param label Label is a description of the Task to be added.
* Constructor called when adding a Deadline or Event Task to the list.
* @param type Type tells execute method the kind of Task object to create.
* @param label Label is a description of the Task to be added.
* @param date Date is an added description accompanying Deadline and Event tasks.
public AddCommand(String type, String label, LocalDate date) {
* Adds a Task to the TaskList. Differentiates Task objects based on their label
* before adding them to the TaskList.
* @param tasklist TaskList that contains all the users current tasks.
* @param ui Ui object for interaction with user
* @param store Storage object that handles save and load functionality.
public void execute(TaskList tasklist, Ui ui, Storage store) {
* Each function of the application is implemented by creating a class that extends Command. That class overrides
* execute to achieve its specific task. Common features to all Commands implemented here.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasklist, Ui ui, Storage store);
* This method is just for control purposes, to indicate when the application should exit
* @return Boolean that is true when the application should exit.
* Implements the logic for deleting tasks from the users list.
* Constructor called when deleting a task from the TaskList.
* @param index Index of item to be deleted
* Deletes a task from the TaskList.
* @param tasklist TaskList that contains all the users current tasks.
* @param ui Ui object for interaction with user
* @param store Storage object that handles save and load functionality.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException If user gives an index not corresponding to an item in the list.
public void execute(TaskList tasklist, Ui ui, Storage store) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException {
* This command is for making the application exit.
* Constructor sets the isDone field to true. This is the only place where this happens.
* @param tasklist TaskList that contains all the users current tasks.
* @param ui Ui object for interaction with user
* @param store Storage object that handles save and load functionality.
public void execute(TaskList tasklist, Ui ui, Storage store){}
public void execute(TaskList tasklist, Ui ui, Storage store) {
* Indicates that the user has given a command that is not understood. The distinction from exceptions in this project
* is that exceptions are thrown if the user gives a command that is understood, but has problems.
* Prints a message informing the user that their command was not understood.
* @param tasklist TaskList that contains all the users current tasks.
* @param ui Ui object for interaction with user
* @param store Storage object that handles save and load functionality.
public void execute(TaskList tasklist, Ui ui, Storage store) {
* This command is for displaying the users current list of tasks
* Uses the Ui object to display a list of the users tasks
* @param tasklist TaskList that contains all the users current tasks.
* @param ui Ui object for interaction with user
* @param store Storage object that handles save and load functionality.
public void execute(TaskList tasklist, Ui ui, Storage store) {
* Implements the logic for marking a Task as done in the users list.
* Constructor called when marking a Task as done
* @param index Index indicates the Task to be marked.
* Marks a task as done and prints a message that reflects the change to notify the user.
* @param tasklist TaskList that contains all the users current tasks.
* @param ui Ui object for interaction with user
* @param store Storage object that handles save and load functionality.
public void execute(TaskList tasklist, Ui ui, Storage store) {
* Class for Deadline type Task objects.
* Basic constructor for Deadline Task objects.
* @param date date associated with the Task.
* @return "D" as an identifier for other parts of the application.
* Class for Event type Task objects.
* Basic constructor for Event Task objects.
* @param date date associated with the Task.
* @return "E" as an identifier for other parts of the application.
* Abstract parent of all Task objects in the application.
* Basic constructor, creates a task with the given label.
* @param label The description the task is created with. Not allowed to be empty.
* Method used to mark the task as done.
* @param flag Indicates whether the task is marked as done.
* Getter for type. Implementation left to subclasses.
* @return a capital letter in a string e.g. "D" for a Deadline Task.
* Getter for date. Not applicable for Todo tasks.
* @return A String representing the date associated with the Task.
* Override of toString to provide a user friendly String representation of Task objects.
* @return a String representing the Task meant to be printed for the user.
* Class for Todo type Task objects.
* Basic constructor for Todo Task objects.
* @return "T" as an identifier for other parts of the application.
//store is irrelevant, tl code is simple enough that i did not stub it.
Command c = new AddCommand("todo", "a simple todo task");
Task expected = new Todo("a simple todo task");
Command c = new AddCommand("deadline", "a simple deadline task", date);
Task expected = new Deadline("a simple deadline task", date);
Command c = new AddCommand("event", "a simple event task", date);
Task expected = new Event("a simple event task", date);
